pullRequest.title: Introduce `CatchAllTransportObserver` that catches and logs unexpected exceptions
pullRequest.bodyText:
Motivation:
We have to make sure that all invocations of observer methods are safe and do not
impact normal ST operations. Currently, we do that via safeReport utilities that
are used everywhere. It's easy to forget to make an invocation safe in all places.
Modifications:

Add CatchAllTransportObserver implementation that makes sure all unexpected
exceptions are logged;
Add public TransportObservers factory that can convert any observer into its safe
version;
Wrap the passed by users TransportObserver with
TransportObservers#asSafeObserver instead of using safeReport utilities for all
invocations of observer API;

Result:
A single place that makes sure all calls to TransportObserver are safe and do not
throw an exception.

commit.message:
Introduce `CatchAllTransportObserver` that catches and logs unexpected exceptions

Motivation:

We have to make sure that all invocations of observer methods are safe and do not
impact normal ST operations. Currently, we do that via `safeReport` utilities that
are used everywhere. It's easy to forget to make an invocation safe in all places.

Modifications:

- Add `CatchAllTransportObserver` implementation that makes sure all unexpected
exceptions are logged;
- Wrap the passed `TransportObserver` with `CatchAllTransportObserver` instead of
using `safeReport` utilities for all invocations of observer API;

Result:

Single places that makes sure all calls to `TransportObserver` are safe and do not
throw an exception.

nodes.bodyText: Should I make it public to be able to use in TransportObserverConnectionFactoryFilter with BiTransportObserver?

Usage in BiTransportObserver is a weaker reason to make this public (it can assume the passed observers are already wrapped) but I think this functionality is useful in general.
Instead of exposing this implementation publicly WDYT about having TransportObservers class which can have a method asSafeObserver(TransportObserver) (and other variants if needed) so users can choose to partially wrap observers wherever required. Additionally we can check in that method if the passed observer is already wrapped and short-circuit the wrapping.
